org.jpc.term

Class Term

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpc.term.Term
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractVar, Atom, Compound, JRef, NumberTerm

    public abstract class Term
extends Object
    Implementations of this interface are Java representations of Prolog Terms (i.e., Prolog data types) Disclaimer: First versions of this class had some methods inspired or taken from the JPL library (specially method comments). Although the current version has diverged enough to be considered a new implementation, some method comments may still be quite similar, with minor adaptations, as they were originally found in the JPL library.
    Author:
    scastro

      • isHilog

        public boolean isHilog()
        Returns:
        true if the term is a proper Hilog term (i.e., a Hilog term that is not a Prolog term)

      • arg

        public Term arg(int i)
        Returns the ith argument (if any) of this Term. Arguments are counted from 1. throws an IndexOutOfBoundsException if i is inappropriate.
        Returns:
        the ith argument (counting from one) of this Term.

      • getArgs

        public List<Term> getArgs()
        Returns the arguments list of this term. If the term has no arguments will return an empty list
        Returns:
        the arguments of this term

      • arity

        public int arity()
        Returns the arity (i.e., number of arguments) of this Term.
        Returns:
        the arity (1+) of this Term. Returns 0 if the term does not have any arguments (i.e., the Term is an instance of Compound)

        public abstract boolean hasFunctor(Functor functor)
        Whether this term has a given functor.
        Parameters:
        functor - the functor of this term.
        Returns:
        true if the term has the given functor. False otherwise.

      • asList

        public ListTerm asList()
        Returns a list representation of this term. Throws an exception if the term cannot be converted to a list (if it is not either the atom '[]' or a cons compound term)
        Returns:
        a list representation of this term.

      • listLength

        public int listLength()
        the length of this list, iff it is one, else an exception is thrown
        Returns:

        Throws:
        LException

      • isGround

        public abstract boolean isGround()
        Returns:
        true if the term is ground (it does not have unbound variables). false otherwise.

      • replaceVariables

        public Term replaceVariables(Map<String,? extends Term> map)
        Returns a term with all the occurrences of the variables in the parameter map replaced with its associated value (converted to a term)
        Parameters:
        map - maps variable names to values.
        Returns:
        a new term with its variables replaced according to the map

        Replace all the variable names according to the map parameter
        Parameters:
        map - maps variable names to new names
        Returns:
        a new term with its variables renamed according to the map

      • termEquals

        public boolean termEquals(Term t)
        Test if this object is equivalent to the term representation of the object sent as parameter This is not testing for equality in a mathematical sense, for example: 'new Variable("_").equals(new Variable("_"))' is false, since both the receiver and the arguments are anonymous variables, not the same variable. But: 'new Variable("_").termEquals(new Variable("_"))' is true, since they both have the same term representation
        Parameters:
        termAdaptable -
        Returns:

      • termEquals

        public static boolean termEquals(List<? extends Term> list1,
                 List<? extends Term> list2)
        Parameters:
        list1 - a list of Terms
        list2 - another list of Terms
        Returns:
        true if all of the Terms in the (same-length) lists are pairwise term equivalent

        Parameters:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • resolveBindings

        public final Term resolveBindings()
        Part of the internal unification API. This method should not be used by the programmer.
        Returns:
        a term where the bindings of the variables of the receiver have been applied.

        Returns:
        a map of variable names to their unified values.

      • prepareForFrame

        public final Term prepareForFrame()
        Method only required for internal usage of the JPC Prolog engine. Every time a new clause is visited when backtracking, a new frame is created.
        Returns:
        a term to be used in a new frame.

        public abstract Term prepareForFrame(CompilationContext context)
